Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Poirier is eligible to deduct the full amount of his farming losses under Section 31 of the Income Tax Act
Governing_Law: Section 31 of the Income Tax Act
Application_Facts: Mr. Poirier invested significantly in a Charolais cattle breeding operation, combining it with other business interests; despite initial financial success in non-farming businesses, his farming investment was substantial and intended to be profitable
Decision_Outcome: The court concluded that Mr. Poirier's farming operation was a significant business endeavor with a reasonable expectation of profit, qualifying as his chief source of income
Court_Ruling: Appeal allowed; Mr. Poirier can deduct full farming losses
Grounds_for_Claim: Dispute over the application of Section 31 regarding farming loss deductions
Legal_Standard: Farming must be the taxpayer's chief source of income to qualify for full loss deductions under Section 31
Assessment_Factor: Substantial investment in farming, intent to generate profit, integration with other business activities
Evidence_Used: Analysis of Section 31, related case law, financial records of farming and non-farming businesses
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 31 of the Income Tax Act
Application_Basis: Whether farming constituted Mr. Poirier’s chief source of income
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and scale of farming operations, profitability expectations, time and capital invested
Relief_Sought: Allowance of full farming loss deductions
Governing_Rule: Section 31 of the Income Tax Act limits farming loss deductions unless farming is the taxpayer's chief source of income
Cause_Description: Dispute over the application of Section 31 regarding farming loss deductions
Evidence_Handling: Judicial review and analysis of tax reassessment and supporting legal framework
Legal_Provision: Section 31 of the Income Tax Act
Evidence_Assessment: Evaluated whether farming could be considered Mr. Poirier's chief source of income
Decision_Rationale: Mr. Poirier's farming operation was a significant business endeavor with a reasonable expectation of profit, thus qualifying as his chief source of income
Legal_Standard_Applied: Section 31 of the Income Tax Act – requirement that farming be the chief source of income for full loss deduction eligibility
